text: At one and the same time, therefore, occur the beat of the apex, the thickening of the heart walls, and the forcible expulsion of their contained blood by the contraction of the ventricles. Going on in Chapter Three to the movement of the arteries, likewise gauged from the dissections of living animals, Harvey noted that contraction of the heart and the apex beat occur in systole, simultaneously with dilatation of the arteries and of the artery-like vein, and expulsion of the ventricular content. At one and the same fime, therefore, occur the beat Of the apex, the thickening of the heart walls, and the forcible expulsion of their contained blood by the dissections of living animals, Harvey noted that contraction of the heart and the apex beat occur in systole,simultaneously with dilatation of the arteries and of the artery-like vein,and expuslion of the ventricular content.
